channel.title: INtech
channel.description: This is an interleaved feed of the most recent entries from INtech, skipping any feeds with errors.

item.title: At Nintendo’s New Museum, Classic Games Get Reinvented for Today
item.description: The Nintendo Museum, which opens in Kyoto in October, lets visitors play decades-old games using new controllers, smartphone cameras, and image recogn...

item.title: This founder had to train his AI not to rickroll people
item.description: Flo Crivello was monitoring outputs from the AI assistants his company Lindy makes when he noticed something strange. A new client had asked her Lindy...

item.title: The Best Google Pixel Phones of 2024, Tested and Reviewed: Which Model to Buy, Cases and Accessories, Feature Drops
item.description: Here’s a guide to all the models—plus Pixel case recommendations and smart software tricks to try.

item.title: Apple is bringing audio sharing to Beats Studio Pro via firmware update
item.description: A firmware update is delivering multi-user audio sharing, allowing music to be streamed to multiple headphones at once. © 2024 TechCrunch. All rights ...

item.title: Google Pixel 9, Pixel 9 Pro, and Pixel 9 Pro XL Review: All Grown Up
item.description: Come for the smart design and the fantastic camera. Stay for the reality-blurring image manipulation features and the next-level chatbot.

item.title: Gamified rower startup Aviron branches out into bikes
item.description: At around $2,000, the Fit Bike places the system between Peloton’s entry-level Bike ($1,500) and Bike+ ($2,500). © 2024 TechCrunch. All rights reserve...

item.title: 57 Best Back-to-School College Dorm Essentials and Gear (2024)
item.description: Deck out your room and make class a cinch with these WIRED-tested favorites.

item.title: First look at the Startup Battlefield judges at TechCrunch Disrupt 2024
item.description: The Startup Battlefield is the crown jewel of Disrupt, and we can’t wait to see which of the thousands of applicants will be selected to pitch to pane...

item.title: An ‘AI Scientist’ Is Inventing and Running Its Own Experiments
item.description: Letting programs learn through “open-ended” experimentation may unlock remarkable new capabilities, as well as new risks.

item.title: D-ID launches an AI video translation tool that includes voice cloning and lip sync
item.description: AI video creation platform D-ID is the latest company to ship a tool for translating videos into other languages using AI technologies. However, in th...
